title: [COYS - Bale返來吧] 熱刺球迷吹水區 72

replies.msg:
COME ON YOU SPURS



熱刺是一間座落英國倫敦北部托定咸區的職業足球會
從1882年成立至今已經擁有過百年歷史，現時競逐於英格蘭超級聯賽；
球會主場為白鹿徑球場，球會的拉丁文格言 ”Audere est Facere (To Dare Is To Do)” 則意謂「敢作敢為」








(部份圖片由淫心黃黃巴打提供)


榮耀：

甲組聯賽 冠軍：1950/1951、1960/1961
足總盃 冠軍：1900/1901、1920/1921、1960/1961、1961/1962、1966/1967、1980/1981、1981/1982、1990/1991
聯賽盃 冠軍：1970/1971、1972/1973、1998/1999、2007/2008
歐洲盃賽冠軍盃 冠軍：1962/1963
歐洲足協杯 冠軍：1971/1972、1983/1984

Tottenham have rejected three bids believed to be £20m / £22m and £25m for Belgian midfielder Mousa Dembele from AC Milan.

(Sky Sports Italia)
----------------------------

Spurs have made it public that due to the transfer fee likely needed and the players wages now since signing his new deal in Madrid there is no chance the club can bring Gareth Bale back. It is believed Bale earns circa £500,000 a week (before tax) and has a contract until 2022.

(BBC Sports / Sky Sports News)
----------------------------

Manchester United are feeling less confident in wrapping up a deal for Toby Alderweireld before the World Cup as Tottenham have made it clear they will not budge on the asking price unless Martial is available to come the other way.

(Daily Mirror)
----------------------------

Everton are willing to pay £40m for Danny Rose as the players future remains uncertain. The England left back last summer tried to force a move away, despite a long term injury, by running the club down in the national press - despite recently saying he expects to stay next season Pochettino could decide to sell him.

(The Sun)
----------------------------

Tottenham and Leicester are both weighing up making an offer for West Brom's Ahmed Hegazi.

(The Sun)
----------------------------

Tottenham remain keen on Ajax duo De Light and Kluivert and hope their good relationship with the Dutch giants will assist them in beating rivals Roma and Manchester United to the respective players signatures.

(ESPN)
----------------------------

Tottenham academy player Reo Griffiths is expected to leave the club this summer and move abroad. Griffiths, who ended the season top scored in the U18's league has attracted attention from Germany, Spain and Italy.

(Yahoo Sports)
----------------------------

Tottenham have not given up on signing the Sessengnon twins and hope they can beat their rivals by doing a deal with cash now and a loan back agreed so Fulham have the players for their first season in the Premier League and money to spend.

(Daily Star)
----------------------------

Pochettino has told Daniel Levy he does not mind Toby Alderweireld joining a Premier League rival. Many fans have been left frustrated by the clubs stance in selling to rival teams however the Argentinian manager is the one who has green lit the deal.

(Daily Star)
----------------------------

Barcelona hope to wrap up a deal for Ateltico Madrid's Griezman in the coming weeks when they trigger his £85m release clause. However the Spanish champions are also looking at Christian Eriksen as a possible summer signing.

(Daily Mail)
----------------------------

Christian Pulisic has become Tottenham's number one transfer target this summer as he meets the profile requested by manager Pochettino but is also the 'golden boy' of football in the USA, a market Tottenham chairman Daniel Levy is keen to exploit.

(Daily Express)
----------------------------

All stories taken from the press on 29th May 2018

籲哈利傾退「熱」

【now.com體育】前熱刺射手白花油膠刀認為良禽擇木而棲，哈利傾欲事業更上一層樓的話，必須離開熱刺，轉投實力更強的球會。

白花油膠刀（Roman Pavlyuchenko）認為，如熱刺前鋒，並會在今屆世界盃出任英格蘭隊長的哈利傾（Harry Kane）欲取得更大發展，就非要轉投像皇家馬德里或巴塞隆拿般的歐洲大球會不可：「如巴塞隆拿和皇家馬德里向他招手，那就答應，他必須前往，但如只是加盟一些西班牙或意大利的中游隊伍，那就不值得了。」

該名前熱刺前鋒續說：「然而，他必須先了解自己所想，可以肯定的是，若巴塞和皇馬邀其加盟，那過檔也是正常。熱刺無疑是一間大球會，但他們並沒有比賽至歐聯的最後階段，當然，如他想更進一步，就必須加盟一間更具規模的球會。」

傾近季在英超一直表現出色，早前曾連續兩屆榮膺英超神射手，上季也只是遇上了大勇的利狗斷手前鋒沙拉，才未能連續3屆奪該殊榮。

Rumour & press review.

As always, grab a pinch of salt for most of these but (not telling which one) I know from a very reliable source one is true... -SJ
---------------------------------

Tottenham are continuing to track Soloman Rondon of West Brom as a potential striker replacement for Fernando Llorente who is expected to head to Spain this summer.

(Daily Mirror)
---------------------------------

Spurs are considering an offer for Stoke playmaker Xherdan Shaqiri who is believed to have a £12m release clause following relegation.

(Daily Mirror)
---------------------------------

Manchester Utd are considering their options having had a £55m offer for Toby Alderweireld refused by Daniel Levy who has demanded Antony Martial be included or a fee closer to £75m for the Belgian defender.

(The Sun)
---------------------------------

Academy player Marcus Edwards looks set to follow the trend for young English players and move abroad with Ajax keen on the young attacker. Edwards is under contract with Spurs until 2020 but is said to be wanting to leave for first team opportunities.

(The Sun)
---------------------------------

Tottenham have pulled out of the race to sign highly rated Ajax defender Matthijs de Ligt due to the fee required. Spurs believed they could do a deal sub £50m however Ajax will not move from their £60m asking price.

(Football London)
---------------------------------

Newcastle defender Jamaal Lascelles is a new target for Tottenham as they plan for life after Toby Alderweireld.

(The Sun)
---------------------------------

Tottenham are leading the race to sign Aston Villa attacking midfielder Jack Grealish. Spurs value the player sub £20m however it is believed Villa want closer to £40m.

(Daily Mail)
---------------------------------

Inter Milan believe they are close to agreeing a deal for Spurs Belgian midfielder for a fee in the region of £25m.

(Daily Express)
---------------------------------

Tottenham have ended their interest in Zaha due to Palace demanding £75m for the attacker.

(London Evening Standard)
---------------------------------

(Stories taken from press on 8th June 2018)

純粹分享 如果大家覺得too long didn’t read 都唔緊要



Fact is though we have a limited budget and it's not as simple as just "get them now". I have posted some of the issues in other posts but I will try and explain a bit one more time.

When I refer to "the players" that can mean the players themselves, the agents, their family members, and more often than not a combination of all three.

A club like ours will compile a shortlist of players that fit the need for the club. The players are no different. They will have their own list of clubs they would like to go to.....
boyhood clubs
playing time
great manager and/or players
CL football
location
financials
etc etc.

We make our interest known to the selling club and agent, and the absolute first thing they do is look to see if they can do better elsewhere(that's their job). This might take time, for numerous reasons....

A preferred club is interested but needs to sell first,
the club has an alternative they would prefer but strings the player along just in case
Difference of opinion on the transfer fee/wages between the buying club and selling club/agent
Or like now an upcoming world cup which could change the desire in their players.

We are not top of the food chain(but we are not far off) so when we are looking at squad players it's usually a pretty easy decision from the players/agents POV, but the selling club is still going to look at maximising the transfer fee by selling elsewhere first. If the player is set on joining us and the selling club can get more elsewhere this will drag it out. Then the agent might think the other team will pay more = more delays. Then there is the players family that needs persuading etc etc.

The fact is in the early part of the window we are trying to do stuff but there are hurdles everywhere. In the last 2-3 weeks of the window the players/agents/clubs pretty much know where they stand. Other clubs are needing income to do their deals, players/agents are getting edgy and prepared to take less, and most importantly the Elite clubs aren't likely to force the prices up with their interest.

It's simple really, if we want players that none of the other teams would want it's easy. If we want our top choices then all the above has to align first and that takes time to happen.

Of course it is possible to get these deals done early ala Liverpool , but the fact is they are overpaying(quite significantly), both is Agents fee's and signing on fee's to do so. I'm sure there will be numerous posters now saying "well we should do the same". Firstly Levy does not operate like that, and secondly we have a budget, a transfer kitty a war chest call it what you will, but with everything else going on regarding stadium and pay rises it does have it's limit.

If we go down the route of greasing the wheels a deal which should cost £40 mil now costs £46. That's not just £6mil off the transfer fee of the next player. Well it's only £6mill, nothing in the grand scheme of things right? Wrong because when we come to sign player 2 his agent won't do business until he gets his Brucie bonus either. If Poch wants/needs 3 players in by the time we get to player three we can't get close to affording him and we are left short.

Now all that said I'm sure the nay sayers will come diving in with "If we hadn't wasted money on blah blah blah we wouldn't be in this position" Well maybe that's true, but our approach has been to buy lots of middle of the road(financially speaking) players with potential knowing some will work and some won't. You can't list all the flops without all the successful players either. Added to that how many of the so called flops have we actually lost money on, because they may not have performed on the pitch, but if they haven't cost us financially then they aren't really a massive problem.


Poch is very aware of how things work. If he wants his top targets sometimes it comes at a cost as far as timeline is concerned.
